title: President Truman's campaign train

title: President Truman receives report from President's Advisory Commission on Universal Training

title: Portrait of General Bruce C. Clarke
Scopenote: Bruce C. Scopenote: Secretary of the Navy Francis P. Matthews is shown in the center shaking hands with an unidentified woman in a short receiving line. Scopenote: U.S. Secretary of the Navy Francis P. Matthews is shown in the center in suit and hat while on inspection tour of the U.S. Naval Shipyard located at San Francisco, California. He is passing by an honor guard and the soldiers and the U.S. Navy officers in view are not identified.

title: Secretary of the Navy Francis P. Matthews on Inspection Visit of U.S. Navy Supply Center
Scopenote: U.S. Navy Secretary Francis P. Matthews is standing on the far left with two unidentified U.S. Navy officers and a Marine.  Secretary Matthews is on an inspection tour visit of the Naval Supply Center located at Oakland, California.

title: Navy Secretary Francis P. Matthews Visiting Naval Supply Center in California
Scopenote: U.S. Secretary of the Navy Francis P. Matthews is seated in the center drinking coffee and conferring with U.S. Navy officers and others.  At the time Secretary Matthews was on an inspection tour of the Naval Supply Center located in Oakland, California.

title: Secretary of the Navy Francis P. Matthews on Inspection Tour of Naval Supply Center
Scopenote: U.S. Secretary of the Navy Francis P. Matthews is shown with various U.S. Naval officers while on an inspection tour of the Naval Supply Center located in Oakland, California.  The men appear to be in a warehouse and standing by a U.S. Navy ground coffee box unit.

title: Secretary of the Navy Francis P. Matthews on Inspection Tour of Naval Supply Center
Scopenote: U.S. Secretary of the Navy Francis P. Matthews is shown in the center of the photograph wearing a hat and suit.  He is on an inspection tour of the U.S. Naval Supply Center located in Oakland, California.  He appears to be in a warehouse facility and inspecting some type of assembly line operation.  Unidentified assembly line workers, Navy officers and another man are also in view.

Scopenote: U.S. Secretary of the Navy Francis P. Matthews is shown second from the left wearing a suit and hat.  He is on an inspection tour of the Naval Supply Center (later called the Fleet and Industrial Supply Center) located in Oakland, California.  He is in a warehouse looking at a roaster machine with four unidentified U.S. Naval officers and another man.

title: Navy Secretary Francis P. Matthews Inspects Treasure Island in California
Scopenote: U.S. Navy Secretary Francis P. Matthews is shown standing in the center with a group of mainly Navy officers standing behind him.  Secretary Matthews is to inspect the Naval Station and Receiving Station on Treasure Island in San Francisco Bay.  He was in California in connection with Armed Forces Day ceremonies held at the Presidio in San Francisco.  The group in view is standing at attention during the playing of the Ruffles and Flourishes.

title: Navy Secretary Francis P. Matthews on Inspection Tour At Treasure Island in California
Scopenote: U.S. Navy Secretary Francis P. Matthews, standing on the right wearing a hat and top coat, is shown on an inspection tour of the Naval Station and Receiving Station on Treasure Island in San Francisco Bay in California.  In this view the inspecting party is watching a demonstration at the Fire Fighting School.  The U.S. Navy officers with the Secretary are not identified.  Secretary Matthews was in California to participate in Armed Forces Day ceremonies at the Presidio in San Francisco.

title: Navy Secretary Francis P. Matthews On Inspection Tour in California
Scopenote: U.S. Navy Secretary Francis P. Matthews, standing on the far left, is shown while on an inspection tour of the U.S. Navy facility at Treasure Island in San Francisco Bay. He and some U.S. Navy officers are inspecting the laundry facilities which included automatic washers and dryers recently installed.  Secretary Matthews was in California to participate in Armed Forces Day ceremonies at the Presidio in San Francisco.

title: Navy Secretary Francis P. Matthews in Hawaii
Scopenote: Secretary of the U.S. Navy Francis P. Matthews is standing on the left with a lei around his neck shaking hands with an unidentified man.  He is visiting Pearl Harbor in Hawaii at the time.  A radio microphone for station KGU is shown on the left.

title: Navy Secretary Francis P. Matthews Attends Banquet
Scopenote: Secretary of the U.S. Navy Francis P. Matthews is seated fourth from the right facing the camera. He is attending a banquet given during ceremonies for the dedication of the National Cemetery of the Pacific (Punchbowl Cemetery) in Honolulu, Hawaii. Others in view are not identified nor is the exact location of the banquet.

title: Dedication of the Pacific Memorial Cemetery in Hawaii
Scopenote: A group of men and women are shown seated who were among some of the 6,000 Army, Navy, and civilian spectators who attended the dedication of the National Memorial Cemetery of the Pacific (Punchbowl Cemetery). Secretary of the U.S. Navy Francis P. Matthews gave the principal address.

title: Military and Civilian Leaders Attend Reception in Hawaii
Scopenote: Military leaders in the Hawaiian area and prominent civilians attended a joint Army-Navy-Air Force reception honoring distinguished mainland guests at the Ft. Shafter Officers' Club on Friday, Sept. 2, 1949.  This event was held following the formal dedication of the National Memorial Cemetery of the Pacific located in Honolulu.  Standing third from the left is Lt. General Robert L. Eichelberger, former Commander of the 8th U.S. Army in Japan.  Next to him is Mrs. Leslie J. McNair, widow of General Leslie McNair.

title: Navy Secretary Francis P. Matthews in Hawaii
Scopenote: Secretary of the U.S. Navy Francis P. Matthews is standing on the left and is shown with Fleet Admiral William H. Halsey.  Secretary Matthews is visiting Honolulu for the dedication of the National Cemetery of the Pacific (Punchbowl Cemetery) located in Honolulu.

title: Reception Following Cemetery Dedication in Hawaii
Scopenote: Lt. General Robert L. Eichelberger, former Commander of the 8th U.S. Army in Japan is on the left shown chatting with Mrs. Leslie J. McNair, widow of General Leslie McNair.  They are in attendance at a reception held after the dedication of the National Cemetery of the Pacific in Honolulu, Hawaii.  The reception was held at the Ft. Shafter Officers' Club.

title: President Harry S. Truman Visits Naval Gun Factory
Scopenote: Rear Admiral Frank G. Fahrion, Superintendent of the Naval Gun Factory (Washington Navy Yard), is shaking hands on the left with President Harry S. Truman and greeting him on the 150th anniversary of the gun factory.  Secretary of the U.S. Navy Francis P. Matthews is standing between the two men. Major General Harry Vaughan, on the far right, looks on.

title: Joint Civilian Orientation Conference Held At Fort Benning, Georgia
Scopenote: A group of military and government officials are shown seated together while attending a fifth  Joint Civilian Orientation Conference held at Fort Benning, Georgia on November 4-5, 1949.  Identification includes left to right: General Omar N. Bradley, Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff; Stuart Symington, Secretary of the Air Force; Admiral Forrest P. Sherman, Chief of Naval Operations; Louis Johnson (holding gun), Secretary of Defense; General Hoyt S. Vandenberg, Air Force Chief of Staff; and Secretary of the Navy Francis P. Matthews.

title: Firepower Demonstration At Fort Benning, Georgia
Scopenote: View is identified as maneuvers held during the fifth Joint Civilian Orientation Conference at Fort Benning, Georgia held early in the month of November, 1949.

title: Firepower Demonstration Held At Fort Benning, Georgia
Scopenote: View is identified as maneuvers held during the fifth Joint Civilian Orientation Conference at Fort Benning, Georgia held early in the month of November, 1949.

title: Navy Secretary Francis P. Matthews Visit Boston Naval Shipyard
Scopenote: Secretary of the U.S. Navy Francis P. Matthews is shown on the right and Rear Admiral Leo Hewlett Thebaud, Commandant of the First Naval District, is at salute beside him.  They are responding to military honors rendered by the Boston Naval Base Band.  Secretary Matthews is on a visit to the Boston Naval Shipyard.  Part of a Marine Corp. detachment are also in view.

title: Navy Secretary Francis P. Matthews on Visit to First Naval District
Scopenote: U.S. Secretary of the Navy Francis P. Matthews, second from the left, is shown inspecting the historic frigate USS Constitution during a visit to the Boston Naval Yard. Rear Admiral Leo H. Thebaud is standing third from the right. Others in view are not identified.

title: Navy Secretary Francis P. Matthews Visits Naval District
Scopenote: Secretary of the U.S. Navy Francis P. Matthews is shown inspecting the historic frigate the USS Constitution during a visit to the Boston Naval Shipyard located in the First Naval District.  Sailors are shown in salute as Secretary Matthews passes by.

title: Navy Secretary Francis P. Matthews Visits First Naval District
Scopenote: Secretary of the U.S. Navy Francis P. Matthews is standing on the platform at the podium and addressing United States Naval Shipyard workers in Boston, Massachusetts.  Various Naval officers share the platform with him.  Secretary Matthews is on an inspection visit of the First Naval District.

title: USS Constitution Docked in Harbor
Scopenote: Full view of the historic frigate the USS Constitution docked in Boston, Massachusetts.  The Secretary of the Navy's flag is flying from the masthead of the ship.  Photograph was taken when U.S. Secretary of the Navy Francis P. Matthews was on an inspection tour of the Boston Naval Shipyard in the First Naval District.

title: Secretary of the Navy Francis P. Matthews Visits Naval Shipyard in Boston
Scopenote: U.S. Secretary of the Navy Francis P. Matthews addresses the workers of the Boston Naval Shipyard during an inspection visit.  The area is part of the First Naval District.

title: Navy Secretary Francis P. Matthews Visiting Naval Shipyard
Scopenote: Secretary of the U.S. Navy Francis P. Matthews is shown standing at the podium addressing Boston Naval Shipyard workers during an inspection visit to the shipyard located in the First Naval District.  Various unidentified Naval officers are standing behind him.

title: Navy Secretary Francis P. Matthews Visits First Naval District
Scopenote: Secretary of the U.S. Navy Francis P. Matthews is shown walking toward the steps to the platform where he will address workers at the Boston Naval Shipyard located in the First Naval District. Several Naval officers are following behind him.  This event was held during an inspection visit by Secretary Matthews.

title: Assistant Secretary of the Navy Sworn In
Scopenote: Admiral Forrest P. Sherman, Chief of Naval Operations, is standing on the left and congratulating John F. Floberg after he was sworn in as Assistant Secretary of the Navy for Air.  Standing in the center is Francis P. Matthews, Secretary of the U.S. Navy.

title: South Porch of Little White House in Key West, Florida
Scopenote: Interior view showing a portion of the south porch area in the Little White House in Key West, Florida.  Photograph was taken when Navy Secretary Francis P. Matthews and his wife Mary were visiting from February 9-17, 1950.

Scopenote: Interior view of a portion of President Harry Truman's bedroom in the north second floor suite #4 at the Little White House in Key West, Florida. Scopenote: Interior view of the living room at the Little White House in Key West, Florida.  Photograph was taken while Navy Secretary Francis P. Matthews and his wife Mary were visiting from February 9-17, 1950.

title: Farewell Dinner for Irish Minister to U.S
Scopenote: Secretary of the U.S. Navy Francis P. Matthews is shown on the right while in attendance at a farewell dinner for Sean Nunan, on the left, minister to the United States from Ireland.  The event took place at the Carlton Hotel in Washington, D.C.

title: Reception Held at Guantanamo Base in Cuba
Scopenote: Francis P. Matthews, Secretary of the U.S. Navy, is standing on the far right and is being honored at a reception held during the Portrex Operation.  Those in view are on the terrace of the Officers Club at Guantanamo Base, Cuba.  Portrex was a joint armed forces operation in the Caribbean area.  Standing second to the left of Secretary Matthews is General Mark Clark.

title: Navy Secretary Francis P. Matthews on Inspection Tour in New Orleans
Scopenote: Secretary of the U.S. Navy Francis P. Matthews is shown walking between the Naval Air Station Marine Detachment while on an inspection tour in New Orleans, Louisiana.

title: Navy Secretary Francis P. Matthews Steering Boat While on Far East Tour
Scopenote: Secretary of the U.S. Navy Francis P. Matthews takes over the helm of Rear Admiral H. H. McLean's barge during inspection of waterfront facilities at Yokosuka Naval Base.  The location is off the coast of Korea.  Secretary Matthews was on tour from November 12-30, 1950.

title: Navy Secretary Francis P. Matthews While On Inspection Tour In the Far East
Scopenote: Secretary of the U.S. Navy Francis P. Matthews is shown while on a visit to the Yokosuka Naval Facilities in Japan. He is seen in the bluejacket or enlisted men's Mess Hall at the Navy's Fleet Activities Command, Yokosuka, Japan. Secretary Matthews is addressing the enlisted assembly before joining them for Turkey dinner. Secretary Matthews' trip took place November 12 - November 30, 1950.

title: Navy Secretary Francis P. Matthews On Far East Inspection Tour
Scopenote: Secretary of the U.S. Navy Francis P. Matthews visits Commander, Naval Forces, Far East while at Tokyo, Japan headquarters.  Secretary Matthews is introduced to staff by Vice Admiral Charles Turner Joy, Commanding Officer.  The tour took place November 12 - November 30, 1950.

title: Navy Secretary Francis P. Matthews On Inspection Tour of Far East
Scopenote: Secretary of the U.S. Navy Francis P. Matthews, on the far right, is shown arriving at Commandant, Naval Forces, Far East.  He is walking past sailors giving him a salute.  Secretary Matthews was on an inspection tour of U.S. Naval facilities in the Far East, November 12 - November 30, 1950.

title: Navy Secretary Francis P. Matthews On Far East Inspection Tour
Scopenote: Secretary of the U.S. Navy Francis P. Matthews is shown on the left leaving an elevator after visiting Commandant, Far East headquarters in Tokyo, Japan. He is accompanied by Rear Admiral Arleigh A. Burke after having conferences with Vice Admiral C. Turner Joy and staff. Secretary Matthews' trip took place November 12 - 30, 1950.

title: Navy Secretary Francis P. Matthews Attending Reception During Far East Trip
Scopenote: Secretary of the U.S. Navy Francis P. Matthews is standing on the right. Rear Admiral George R. Henderson, USN Commander Fleet Air Japan, pays his respects to the Secretary at a reception honoring Mr. Matthews held at the Tokyo GHQ Officers Club. Secretary Matthews was on a Far East tour, November 12-30, 1950.

title: Navy Secretary Francis P. Matthews At Reception In Tokyo
Scopenote: Secretary of the U.S. Navy Francis P. Matthews is standing on the right and is shown attending a Flag Officers reception in his honor at the Tokyo GHQ Officers Club.  Secretary Matthews is nearing the end of his Far East tour, November 12-30, 1950.  Also in view standing next to Secretary Matthews is Vice Admiral Charles T. Joy.  Others in view are not identified.

title: Navy Secretary Francis P. Matthews Attending Dinner Event While In Far East
Scopenote: During his visit to Tokyo, Japan, Secretary of the U.S. Navy Francis P. Matthews was feted by R.O.N.S. (Reserve Officers of the Naval Services) with a dinner at the Union Club.  Shown here with the Secretary are Vice Admiral Charles T. Joy and Mrs. Charles T. Joy.  Dates of the Far East trip were November 12-30, 1950.

title: Chapel Located in the Philippines
Scopenote: Interior view of the alter area of a chapel which is located in the Philippines, exact location not given.  Photograph was taken while Secretary of the U.S. Navy Francis P. Matthews was visiting the Philippines as part of his Far East inspection tour, November 12-30, 1950.

title: Navy Secretary Francis P. Matthews in Korea While on Far East Tour
Scopenote: Secretary of the U.S. Navy Francis P. Matthews, far right, is shown conferring with General Oliver P. Smith, Commanding General 1st Marine Division, while on a visit to the Korean War front.  General Smith is pointing out fighting areas on the field map.  Secretary Matthews was on an inspection tour of the Far East, November 12-30, 1950.

title: Navy Secretary Francis P. Matthews Visiting Korean War Front
Scopenote: Secretary of the U.S. Navy Francis P. Matthews (right) is shown shaking hands with Brigadier General Edward Craig, Assistant Division Commander, 1st Marine Division, while he was visiting the Korean War front.  Secretary Matthews was in Korea as part of his Far East inspection tour, November 12-30, 1950.

title: Major General Oliver P. Smith Visits Marine Cemetery in Korea
Scopenote: Major General Oliver P. Smith, United States Marine Corps, visits 1st Marine Division cemetery at Ham Hung, Korea.  Photograph was taken while Secretary of the U.S. Navy Francis P. Matthews was on an inspection tour of the Far East naval facilities, November 12-30, 1950.

title: Navy Secretary Francis P. Matthews on Far East Inspection Tour
Scopenote: Secretary of the U.S. Navy Francis P. Matthews (right) is shown with Vice Admiral Arthur D. Struble on the left and Vice Admiral Charles Turner Joy in the center.  They are studying the photo results of a U.S. Navy attack mission.  Secretary Matthews was touring Naval installations and forces in the Far East, November 12-30, 1950.

title: Navy Secretary Francis P. Matthews Participates in Bond Drive
Scopenote: Secretary of the U.S. Navy Francis P. Matthews is shown standing beside a poster prepared for the Treasury Department's Independence Bond Drive. The Liberty Bell is pictured on the poster.

title: Honor Guard For Navy Secretary Francis P. Matthews
Scopenote: The Naval Reserve personnel of Scranton, Pennsylvania, acted as honor guard to Secretary of the U.S. Navy Francis P. Matthews on the occasion of his attendance at the graduation exercises held at Scranton University, Scranton, Pennsylvania.

title: Graduation Ceremonies at Scranton University
Scopenote: Scene of the graduation exercises taking place in what appears to be the gymnasium at Scranton University in Scranton, Pennsylvania.  Secretary of the U.S. Navy Francis P. Matthews, who attended the event, is probably seated behind the podium.

title: Scranton University Graduation Scene In Pennsylvania
Scopenote: Scene shows crowd of people who were in attendance for the commencement ceremonies at Scranton University in Scranton, Pennsylvania.  Secretary of the U.S. Navy Francis P. Matthews attended the event with his wife.

title: Sailors aboard the U.S.S. Washington
Scopenote: Sailors straddle a 16-inch gun on the forward turret of the U.S.S. Washington, which docked at Philadelphia to participate in the Navy Day celebration.  The 25,000-ton battlewagon was built, launched and commissioned in the Philadelphia Navy Yard in 1941.

title: Stereograph of Harry Truman at a Luncheon with Sam Rayburn
Scopenote: Stereograph of Harry S. Truman with a group of men at a luncheon.  Left to right: Harry S.  Truman, unidentified man, Speaker of the House Sam Rayburn.  From: Lowell Mason's Stereographic Library, Annual Baseball Outing, Volumes I and II.  Photographs are of Baseball, Clam and Chowder Club of the United States Senate, of which Harry S. Truman was a member. Same as 70-4252.

Scopenote: President Truman in first row at a Washington Senators baseball game.  Seated next to him at right are Admiral William Leahy and Press Secretary Charles Ross.  On the base of the stereograph is the typed quote "The President: You see, Bess, these balls aren't as good as the kind I used at Noland."  From; Lowell Mason's Stereographic Library, Annual Baseball Outing, Volumes I and II.  Photographs are of Baseball, Clam and Chowder Club of the United States Senate, of which Harry S. Truman was a member.

title: Stereograph of President Truman Throwing out a Baseball at a Game
Scopenote: Stereograph of President Harry S. Truman throwing out a ball at a Washington Senators baseball game.  Bess Truman and Margaret Truman are at his left.  From; Lowell Mason's Stereographic Library, Annual Baseball Outing, Volumes I and II.  Photographs are of Baseball, Clam and Chowder Club of the United States Senate, of which Harry S. Truman was a member.

Scopenote: Stereograph of group of Senators placing bets on Lowell Mason's baseball board.  James Mead is standing at the rear. Photographs are of Baseball, Clam and Chowder Club of the United States Senate, of which Harry S. Truman was a member.

Scopenote: Stereograph of Senator and Mrs. Harry S. Truman at a baseball game for the Washington Senators.  Margaret Truman can be seen at the far left. Photographs are of Baseball, Clam and chowder club of the United States Senate, of which Harry S. Truman was a member.

Truman was a member.

title: Stereograph of group of Senators at a Dinner Table
Scopenote: Stereograph of a group of men at a dinner table.  Printed on back of card: Ed Johnson tried to sell a bill of goods, Jim Meade is skeptical, Carl Hatch and Bob La Follette listen to the President Pro-Tempore.  That's Wallace White watching Joe Martin take of drink of water.  From: Lowell Mason's Stereographic Library, Annual Baseball Outing, Volumes I and II.  Photographs are of Baseball, Clam and Chowder Club of the United States Senate, of which Harry S. Truman was a member.

title: Stereograph of Robert Taft standing next to and easel
Scopenote: Stereograph of Senator Robert Taft standing next to an easel with a card "Our Motto: No Nation can be truly great that hath not some child like in its life of every day.  It should its youth renew with simple joys that sweetly recreate the jaded mind."  From; Lowell Mason's Stereographic Library, Annual Baseball Outing, Volumes I and II.  Photographs are of Baseball, Clam and Chowder Club of the United States Senate, of which Harry S. Truman was a member.

title: President Harry S. Truman's Bedroom in Little White House in Key West, Florida
Scopenote: This is an interior view of a portion of President Harry S. Truman's bedroom in the north second floor suite #4 at the Little White House in Key West, Florida. The President's bed, desk, and other furniture are in view. Photograph was taken while Navy Secretary Francis P. Matthews and his wife Mary were visiting from February 9-17, 1950.

title: Retirement Party for Navy Secretary Francis P. Matthews
Scopenote: Secretary of the Navy Francis P. Matthews attends a party celebrating his retirement from the Navy to become United States Ambassador to Ireland. The party took place in the Pentagon offices of Secretary Matthews. From left to right: unidentified Navy WAVE officer; Secretary Matthews; Mary (Mrs. Francis) Matthews; unidentified Navy WAVE officer.

title: Francis P. Matthews
Scopenote: Portrait of Francis P. Matthews, Secretary of the Navy, 1949-1951.

title: Trumans and Others at Library Dedication
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman on the day of the dedication of the Harry S. Truman Library. From left to right Mrs. Bess Truman, Mrs. Eleanor Roosevelt, Chief Justice Earl Warren, former President Herbert Hoover, Basil O'Connor, president of Truman Library, Inc., and former President Truman.

title: President Truman steering a ship
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman steering the training ship the Eagle while visiting the U. S. Coast Guard Academy in New London, Connecticut.  From the album "Presidential Visit - U. S. Coast Guard Academy, September 20, 1952".

title: Portrait of Bernard Dickmann with Autograph
Scopenote: Portrait of Bernard Dickmann, who was the postmaster and former mayor of St. Louis, Missouri, and a friend of Harry S. Truman. The photo is autographed on the matte "to my friend, John Snyder, 11/8/48, Barney Dickmann."    From:  Album of photographs (portraits) of members of Congress, White House office staff, and other government officials, each autographed for the Secretary of the Treasury, John Snyder.

title: Portrait of Tom Evans
Scopenote: Tom Evans, Kansas City businessman and civic leader.  Photo donated by Harry S. Truman.

title: Portrait of Jonathan Daniels
Scopenote: Portrait of Jonathan Daniels.  The photo is autographed "To Harry Truman with [illegible] and affection.  Jonathan Daniels."  Donor: Harry S. Truman

title: Portrait of George Elsey
Scopenote: Portrait of George Elsey, Administrative Assistant to President Harry S. Truman. The photo is autographed, "To President Truman with devotion and appreciation, George Elsey."

title: Portrait of Walter Bedell Smith
Scopenote: Portrait of General Walter Bedell Smith.  Smith was ambassador to the Soviet Union from 1946 to 1949, and was head of the Central Intelligence Agency from 1950 to 1953.  The photo is autographed on the outside border: "For President Truman, with affection and admiration from Bedell Smith."    Donor: Harry S. Truman.

title: Portrait of Admiral Sidney W. Souers
Scopenote: Portrait of Admiral Sidney W. Souers.  Autographed on original matte:  "To the Honorable Harry S. Truman, a great President and a wonderful friend, with profound respect and admiration.  Sidney W. Souers, Admiral, U.S.N.R. (Ret.)."

title: Portrait of Eugenie Anderson
Scopenote: A portrait of Eugenie Anderson. The photo autographed by Ms. Anderson: "With sincere admiration and affectionate personal regards to a great President, Harry S. Truman, Eugenie Anderson, 5-30-1956."

title: Portrait of Charles Sawyer
Scopenote: Portrait of Charles Sawyer, Secretary of Commerce.  Inscribed: "To Harry S. Truman from Your Secretary of Commerce, Charles Sawyer."  Donor: Harry S. Truman.

title: Truman inspecting Fort Leonard Wood, Missouri
Scopenote: Photograph of the visit and tour of inspection of Senator Harry S. Truman to Ft. Leonard Wood, Mo., Aug. 21, 1942. Included in the party from Washington, D.C. was Under Secretary of War Robert P. Patterson.

title: Senator Harry S. Truman on Capitol Steps
Scopenote: Senator Harry S. Truman on the steps of the Capitol Building. Same as 77-18.

title: Senator Truman and Trucking Association official
Scopenote: Senator Harry S. Truman (left) and an unidentified official from the American Trucking Association during Christmas celebration.

title: President Truman aboard the U. S. S. Augusta
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman on tour of inspection aboard the U. S. S. Augusta during his voyage to attend the Potsdam Conference in Germany, July 1945.

title: Truman at mess aboard the U. S. S. Augusta
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman at mess with enlisted personnel and officers aboard the U. S. S. Augusta on his voyage to attend the Potsdam Conference in Germany, July 1945.

title: Truman at mess aboard the U. S. S. Augusta
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman at mess with enlisted personnel and officers aboard the U. S. S. Augusta on his voyage to attend the Potsdam Conference in Germany, July 1945.

title: President Truman and Secretary of State Byrnes
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and Secretary of State James F. Byrnes shown together on deck of the U.S.S. Augusta during voyage to attend the Potsdam conference in Germany.

title: The USS Augusta
Scopenote: The USS Augusta during the voyage of President Harry S. Truman to Antwerp, Belgium, July, 1945.  President Truman was on his way to attend the Potsdam Conference in Germany.

title: Eisenhower, Patton, and Truman in Berlin, Germany
Scopenote: At flag-raising ceremony in Berlin, Germany, from left to right, General Dwight Eisenhower, General George Patton, and President Harry S. Truman.  The Flag of Liberation is being raised over the former Nazi headquarters in Berlin. President Truman is in Germany to attend the Potsdam Conference.

title: Harry S. Truman with high school students in Independence, Missouri
Scopenote: Former president Harry S. Trumans meeting with students from Truman High School, Independence, Missouri on the steps of his home. It is Truman's birthday.

title: Portrait of Roger Tubby
Scopenote: Portrait of Roger Tubby used in conjunction with his oral history.

title: President Truman throws out the first pitch at Griffith Stadium
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman throwing out the first pitch to start the season of the Washington Senators. L to R: Vice President Alben Barkley, First Lady Bess Wallace Truman, President Truman, manager of the Washington Senators Bucky Harris, Senators owner Clark Griffith, New York Yankees manager Casey Stengel. Standing in the next row are Major General Harry Vaughan (extreme left); Averell Harriman (behind President Truman); and Matthew Connelly (behind Bucky Harris).

title: Former President Harry S. Truman Admires his New Car
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman admires the chrome trim on his new car, a Chrysler. The car has wire wheels and whitewall tires. The other men standing in the background are unidentified.  Donor: Chicago Sun Times

title: White House Guard Shot in Front of Blair House During Assassination Attempt
Scopenote: Two unidentified men bend over a White House Guard shot down in a gun battle in front of Blair House, the residence of President Harry S. Truman, during an assassination attempt on the President.  It is evidently Leslie Coffelt, who was killed in the attack.

title: Portrait of Truman in National Guard uniform
Scopenote: Lieutenant Harry S. Truman in his World War I National Guard uniform.  He went to France as artillery officer in World War I, and returned as a major.

title: President Truman and Governor Pinero of Puerto Rico in Car
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman waves to the crowd at San Juan, Puerto Rico, as he drives from the airport with Govern Jesus Pinero.  Donor:  Chicago Sun Times.

title: Missouri Officials Confer in Washington
Scopenote: Missouri government officials gather in Washington, D.C. to discuss their state's part in the Rural Electrification program. From left to right: Governor Guy Park; Sam Hargus, Counsel of the Missouri Public Service Commission; Senator Harry S. Truman; and John Caskie Collet, Chairman of the Missouri Public Service Commission.
